selection_reasoning: Selected the top two performers from this generation (trial_1_2 and trial_1_10) plus the two best from generation 0 (trial_0_2 and trial_0_13). This gives us three high-performing optimization-based approaches (all scoring above 2.5) and one alternative strategy (alternating optimization). The focus is on proven performance while maintaining some algorithmic diversity. Many generation 1 trials had implementation errors, but the successful ones show that the optimization-based approaches are consistently reaching scores near the benchmark.

trial_selections.reasoning: Achieved 2.5999, very close to the best score from generation 0 (2.6017) and near the benchmark (2.635). Uses SQP optimization with multiple initializations, showing this approach is consistently strong.

Scored 2.0500 using alternating optimization (fixing radii then positions, then vice versa). This is a fundamentally different optimization strategy that could be further improved with better parameters or more iterations.
